transcript:
Bezu- khov'shouse. "My dear Boris," said the mother, drawing her hand from beneath her old man- tle and laying it timidly and tenderly on her son's arm, "be affectionate and attentive to him. Count Cyril Vladimirovich is your god- father after all, and your future depends on him. Remember that, my dear, and be nice to him, as you so well know how to be." 
"If only I knew that anything besides hu- miliation would come of it . . ." answered her son coldly. "But I have promised and will do
